intro: Kippistia organensis, commonly known as the Organ Mountains false heather, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Kippistia organensis is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
